audio_description: To make Ambur Chicken Biryani, first wash the rice thoroughly and soak it. A special rice is used in this biryani. It's called Seeraga Samba rice. It has a very nice aroma.

audio_description: You’ll find this rice in any supermarket. If it’s not available, you can also make biryani with normal Sona Masoori or Basmati rice. But if you do get this rice, the biryani turns out even better because of its fragrance.

audio_description: After 15 minutes, once the chilies are soft, grind them into a fine paste using a mixer jar. Use a small jar—if you use a big one, it won’t grind properly. Your spicy red chili paste is ready.

audio_description: Cut the chicken pieces to medium or slightly larger size. After adding the chicken, sauté it well with the spices. Keep the flame on medium. Ambur Chicken Biryani is a very famous dish in South India, especially in Tamil Nadu.

audio_description: After sautéing the chicken with the masalas for 1 to 2 minutes on flame, turn the flame off. Now add 4 tablespoons of curd (yogurt). Beat the curd well before adding. We turn off the flame to avoid curdling while adding.

audio_description: We will cook the biryani on low flame for 30 minutes on dum. Don’t forget to place a tawa (griddle) underneath, otherwise the bottom might burn. The tawa is essential. You can also seal the pan edges with dough so the steam doesn’t escape.
